Worst professor I've ever had. His lectures were all over the place and made no sense. Midterm and final were impossible to make an A or B on. Unorganized. Would randomly call names or have a sign in sheet but you can get away w/ not showing up. Does a lot of group work and Kahoots.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: One of the worst professors I have ever had. Spends the majority of class teaching through random Kahoot questions and youtube videos. Tests are take home but extremely difficult and impossible to get an A on. All grades in the class are never posted so you have no idea where you stand in the class. Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Mayer just shows up and teaches. Sometimes you can barely hear him but he writes everything on the board so it's okay. You only have the midterm and final. You get some participation grades in class. He does random attendance too. The class ends earlier than all the other classes.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Prof. Mayer was a great guy. You only have a midterm and final exam, both are take home so make sure to take notes and you will be fine. There are a couple of group projects, but they are super easy. He takes attendance on random days without telling you so make sure to be in class. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is a nice person but I've never had a more disorganized teacher. He gets up and starts randomly mumbling his lectures in an unorganized fashion and I have no idea what's going on. The tests he gives us are take home but really difficult and have little to nothing to do with what he's taught us. It's basically a joke.

Hes a kind man but not a great professor. Writes small print on a tiny white board and continues to stand in front of what he wrote. The notes dont have any rhyme or reason whatsoever. I walked out of class not knowing what I even learned. Exams are take home but impossible to make an A on. Takes attendance randomly in an unorganized fashion.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Mayer was one of the quirkiest professors I've had. I had no idea what my grade was in the class all semester. Students formed groups and had plenty of problems to solve for extra credit and discussion points. At times he was difficult to understand. Not the best teacher, but it wasn't an awful class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Mayer is a very nice person however is a horrible teacher.  He does not use power points and just lectures.  His test are nothing like the notes and the information in the book will not help you with the test either.  If you want an easy class do not take Prof. Mayer.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: One of the hardest classes I've taken, he doesn't teach from the book and gets off topic a lot. the test are very confusing and uses information from the book that he does not teach or remotely talk about.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Worst professor I have ever had. Lectures do not make much sense and then gives extremely detailed exams. Do not recommend
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Extremely hard class. Two tests worth the majority of your grade and are both extremely difficult. If you need an A in this class, reconsider taking him. Extremely nice guy though.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He seems like the nicest guy. He responds to emails. If you try you can pass this class.  If you want to learn something  DONT TAKE this professor. He can not teach to save his life!!! He writes the formulas and problems with the answers. He never explains how to get to the answer. Pick a good group to work with to obtains points. Show up to class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Extremely disorganized, easily irritated by questions and other students. He is definitely a smart man that knows economics, yet his teaching style is very difficult to learn from. He barely covers many topics and then asks in depth questions on tests that are difficult to answer since we never got a full explanation.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Please do not take this professor. His lectures don't make much sense at all. His tests are take home, but they are still very hard. Attendance is taken randomly for a grade. I never missed a class and I cannot recall a thing I learned in the whole course.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He's a very nice guy, but the lectures make no sense. He throws information onto the board without any sort of organized thought and changes the subjects so fast. There are take home tests which should be easy, but they won't be over what's in your notes or what is in the recommended text book.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Mayer's lectures are long and boring; he makes a lot of jokes that aren't  funny, tells irrelevant stories, and refuses to use PowerPoints. Also, most of the grade for this class rests on 2 open book tests. So, if you happened to miss writing down something during one of the dreary lectures, then tough luck. Nope- don't take him.

Professor Mayer was very unclear in his lectures and even though his tests were take home and I have notes from every lecture, the tests were still extremely difficult for me. I would not recommend taking his class.

Professor Mayer may know economics, but he is not a very good teacher. He is not clear in lectures. He seems to just ramble on about topics that are related to his life. He does not input grades online, and at the time of this post, have no clue as to my grade. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR,  move your classes around so you do not have to!

DO NOT TAKE PROFESSOR MAYER! He is not a clear teacher at all. This reviews on here are deceiving. He does not put in grades so you never actually know what you have in the class. Although midterm and final are take home, they are pretty difficult. I wish I took someone else for this course.

Professor Mayers was extremely frustrating and unclear.  It's like he waits until he gets to class to decide what to cover that day.  Then writes with dead markers on the board - sideways.  You have to go to class even though he doesn't teach you anything.  Even though econ is an easy subject, this is just annoying.
EASY CLASS, I would definitely recommend him! He offers a ton of extra credit, TAKE HOME MID TERM & a final

Prof. Mayer is really a nice guy. But this was my least favorite class to take. He tends to get off topic quite a bit. There is a midterm and a final exam. He doesn't like the assigned book at all. So he doesn't use it. However, a lot of what's on the final and midterm are in the book : And he's great w responding to emails.

Attendance counts towards your grade, and tests are hard. But, you only have a midterm and final. Group discussions are also a huge part of your grade. He's a tough teacher and you have to work hard, but he wasn't as bad as I thought he was going to be compared to other reviews. Gives chance at extra credit too.

Not my favorite professor, but it's very possible to get a good grade if you show up. He hates the recommended textbook so never uses it. He allows you to choose your own groups at the beginning of the semester for graded class discussions but they are very easy and laid back. Open book, take home midterm. Partially take home final. Extra Credit.

He's a very nice guy.. But a terrible teacher. The take home tests will give you headaches they are so difficult. He always gets off topic while lecturing and jumps back and forth from different topics making it very hard to take good notes. I don't normally post anything on here but his class is that aggravating.
Simple class, and lectures were pretty boring, but It's easy to make an A if you put the effort forward.

Hard prof for a gen-ed prof. Tests are take-home, but questions are extremely detailed. Final is 50% of your final grade. His instructions are not very clear and he isn't fair. Often he would ask one question to one side of the room, then vice versa. His motto seemed to be "Not everyone can get A's, and not everyone can get F's." Avoid if possible.

Boring!! But easy class! Grades are sample exam, midterm, final,and like 3 or 4 in class discussions in groups. Test are take home! Take good notes and easy A! An 85% is considered an A in that class! But he is so boring, but nice! Take him. Easy A or B!

Never had a more socially awkward professor. Very poor communication. If you take good notes (not just what he writes on the board, but what he actually says) then you'll do fine. I made an A on the first two tests so far & I suck at econ. The tests are take home so if you're really struggling, then use your resources. It's not as bad everyone says
He's really tough. I ended up with a B but I would avoid him if you can. Just don't try. If you do have him, sit in the front row and make sure he knows you.

Easily the worst professor I've ever had. I'm sure he knows what he's talking about, but he's so unclear when trying to teach it. At one point he mentioned being part-time for 20 something years. Near the middle of the semester, I could see why. Stay away from this man.

Horrible. He does give you take home tests but they are so hard that google can't even help you. He also gives a lot of room for bonus but still. He's ADD, his notes do nothing withe the tests and he's boring. I only went because attendance was mandatory
Worst professor ever.  I like econ, but he makes it unbearable. Attendance is mandatory, but you won't learn a thing.  Midterm just got back.  Got an A through the internet (it was a take home test).
I've been in this class one day and I can already tell it's gonna be a strange experience. This dude is pretty damn weird.

Run!!!  The guy seems to know the subject material, but his communication skills are so poor that he can't communicate the material in lecture.  You have to ask him about your grades periodically if you want to know where you stand.  If you want to learn anything, avoid him at all costs!!!

Took him during summer and got an A in course. However I did not learn a thing. Tests were take home...internet helped alot. Material covered in class is very sketchy and unclear at times. Seems unorganized throughout lecture. if econ was my major....i would not take him. since it was gen ed..i winged it

I took his summer class and all of his tests are take home, except for part of the final, and he gives a lot of chances for bonus, but the take home tests are pretty difficult and his notes don't really cover everything. Final coming up and he didn't even mention what was on it. I stayed after class to find out... just... beware!

I got an A. Tests are take home, but a bit tricky; take your time. I was looking forward to this class and was disappointed with instructor. He did not know how to present the material well and make it interesting. He had difficulty answering questions that came up during lecture. Pretty Easy A, but I do not feel like I gained much from class.

he does know what he is teaching but he is terrible at teaching it. when you ask questions he puts you down. he does not post grades during the semester. he also does not respond to emails. this prof has no communication skills. avoid this class if you value your GPA. i never missed a day and did the extra credit and still did not pass

Poorly organized. Not possible to prepare for classes-no dates on syllabus. No homework. Lectures are comprehensive but fail to teach the basics. More liberal bashing than thorough investigation of principles.  5 class discussions instead of lecture where discussion is missing: just shout an answer. Poor value; not recommended.

Tests are all take home, with exception of the final.  Part of ifnal take home and part is in class.  You really need to be in class to get notes for tests. He gives you all answers IF you are at each lecture.  Tests are hard, but with a little time can be done to get an easy grade.  Class is boring if you are not into economics.
Good professor and he does keep your interest. Tests are take home but are pretty hard...google does work! But pretty much was really easy.
Take home tests! Gives extra credit for attendance. Tries to make the class easy.

Really good teacher, pretty funny. Only 2 sample exams, midterm & final (all are TAKE HOME) - for the final there is a small in class portion but nothing ridiculously hard. If you do your work & go you'll definitely make an A. Allows 2  unexcused absences.
Not the most engaging of classes but it was fair enough. Mayer is a good guy who tries to make the class less pressured. Stay on top of assignments and you should do fine.

Nice guy, TAKE HOME TEST! Should I say anymore! Take him, I dont care how hard the test when ITS TAKE HOME, A TON OF EXTRA CREDIT, great class debates, he tries to make a slow subject like a Econ easy for anybody.

Nice guy, cracks himself up. Quizzes are take home, but very time consuming and confusing. Everything requires additional research.  Lots of graphs.  Class discussions also take a lot of research.  Not an easy class.

Nice, funny guy but his teaching style is boring.  All test are take home and relatively easy if you use sources other than your book.  There are a few group discussions that are graded and he does give extra credit opportunities.  He also always lets class out early.

He's a nice guy, laughs a lot. However, being nice does not make one a good teacher. He doesn't explain things well, and he manages to make his tests, while take home, moderately difficult. I also feel there's an inordinate amount of graded group discussions for what should be an easy class. Don't take him if at all possible.

He was kind of boring when he lectured but his tests were take home, and pretty easy. The group work is fun and easy if you get a good group. He also gives extra credit, and responds quickly to emails. Easy A if you do your work!

Funny prof. Lectures are a bit scattered. Tests are hard, but take home. Best bet is to get in with a really good group. I used a lot of outside websites to help me with the tests. I learned a lot. Made an A thanks to extra credit.
Hes a really nice guy, he lets class out early...every time...and hes funny....but his tests....omg. everything is take-home...soo google EVERYTHING! you wont find ANYTHING in ANY book....seriously.

His leactures are so hard to follow. The tests are all take home, but they do not really go with the notes. There are lots of extra credit opportunities. If you just need this class for core then i would recommend it but if you actually need to understand micro, stay away.
I heard this teacher was good. They were WRONGGG. Horrible!!!!! I am so lost in this class. Take home test are extremely difficult. Lectures dont even make since.
DO NOT TAKE HIM! Lectures are random & jumbled. Tests aren't over what he lectured at all. They are take home but that doesn't do you any good. Didn't learn a thing from his class.
I went to class evey time but i didn't learn a thing. He seems unsure of himself and it affects his teaching.

One of the worst teachers I've ever had.  He let class out early all the time and canceled a few classes, so that was good.  He didn't explain things well and his examples were pointless.  If there are other profs available, go with them.

The hardest thing about this class is sitting through his lectures. Attendance is mandatory only because the information for all assignments can be found on the internet. If you go to class, write down everything he writes on the board, and keep up with the handouts you will get an A.

RUN!!!!! This is the worst teacher I have ever had in my life. Take home tests are impossible, his lectures are ridiculously unclear and pertain in the least to what you are tested over. Do yourself a favor and drop this class if you have him. HORRIBLE!

good things- all test take home, plenty of xtra crdt, sample tests give you chance to boost grade.  Bad things- lectures hard to follow, prof is goofy as hell, usually gets off subject, material was difficult, book not that helpful, attendance mandatory. i had to use the internet and classmates to get a B.  "BACK ROW" is the SHYT!!

Took ECON2300 Summer Sem. w/ Prof. MayerHe is a nice person and is knowledgeable about the subject, however he sometimes has difficulty explaining himself. He tells jokes frequently, and also gives plenty of extra credit. His tests are take home, but the material is hard. A majority of my class had trouble w/ the same test questions, typos etc.

I took him for Econ 21 or 2200 and it was a lot easier. I regret taking him over the summer for 2300 because he is awful at teaching. The only way to do good in his class is to get with someone who loves Business Statistics and can teach you because he can't and the book isn't too helpful either. He does give a lot of extra credit though!
Class discussions are a great way to earn extra credit.

STAY AWAY!! There was no way that I should have made a C in this class. I am an A student. His lectures were pointless and did not help at all for the take home test... which by the way, were so far beyond intro to econ it was ridiculous.. his teaching licenses should be revoked!!!

Horrible teacher.  Midterm and final are take home but you did not understand them.  Very awful at lectures.  No other grades except group discussions that ade no sense.  Very hard for a basic economics class. Attendance is very mandatory.  Avoid this teacher if possible.  Barely made a B in the class.

STAY AWAY! Horrible teacher! i did not learn a thing!!!!! His midterm and final are take home but they are very hard and he provides NO help with horrible lectures! no other grades besides pointless group meetings in class and attendance. unless you are already a genius in economics do not take him!
Horrible..stay away. He can not explain things well so you can understand. His test are take home but worded badly. He's sarcastic and don't allow you to speak. This is worst class I've ever taken.
Lectures are difficult to follow, test questions are worded poorly, and I feel I learned more from my econ class in high school. Attendance is mandatory

His is an easy teacher, to get a "A" in his class, all you have to is attend his class and get 850/1000. He does take attendance, the midterm and the exams are all take home and the class discussion are so easy. When we have class discussion, if my team goes on Monday then we have no class on wednesday and sometimes he let us out early.

Tests are all take home, however, he expects you to be able to know his train of thought on questions.  He is not very good at explaining. ECON is all based on theory, but if you do not agree with him then you are wrong regardless if you prove yourself right! FIND ANOTHER TEACHER!!!

I didn't miss a class.  Every test/quiz was take home.  That being said, I still got a B.  He teaches you one way then does a poor job with wording his questions on the test.  I googled some of his terms on the test and they came back not found.

This is the guy to take for Econ., his tests are take home, he's generous with the format of the class and his grade scale; An "A" is 85%, a "B" is 75% etc. He's entertaining and laid back; great teacher.
No Comments
He was never very clear when it came to his lectures, but it doesn't matter because the tests are take home.  He does take attendance.
If you are willing to listen and study, there's no better Econ prof.  He's goofy as can be, but in a really fun way.  All tests are take home, but they are HARD.  I really liked him

Mayer is indeed a character. An "A" in his class is 850/1000 points. I got a low 900 in the class--but I worked my tail off for it. His midterm and exam was take home, but they were far from easy. Work hard and you will reap the fruits of your l

I took him in the summer.  What was supposed to be a 6 hour Saturday class only usuall lasted about 4 hours.  The class discussions were fun, but the tests were take home multiple choice and do not think that means they were easy.  I made Cs on the tests
